data.description: Small gaps (10-20 micron) between the layers in the Z-direction of a model can be 'fixed' by using this setting. Disabling it will ensure the layers will fuse together by printing infill between the bottom and top of the gap.
data.hints:
- If you disable this setting, it won't fill the gap and will simply print the bottom and top as they appear in the model.
- This setting is disabled by default because the chance is extremely small this occurs, but the slice time is quite long.
data.notes: The chance of these kind of gaps is extremely small (<0.1%), only disable the setting if you feel this could solve issues similar to the description.
